meanings.definition: A biostrome is a layer of sedimentary rock that is composed of the remains of living organisms.
meanings.sent1: The biostrome found in the rock formation contained many ancient fossils.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the biostrome to learn about the history of life on Earth.
meanings.sent3: The biostrome in the rocks seemed like a hidden treasure trove of ancient life.
meanings.sent4: The biostrome was a time capsule preserving the secrets of past organisms.
meanings.sent5: Walking through the biostrome felt like stepping back in time to when the creatures roamed the Earth.

meanings.definition: Biostrome can refer to a community of organisms that live together in a specific habitat.
meanings.sent1: The biostrome in the coral reef was teeming with colorful fish and plants.
meanings.sent2: Exploring the biostrome in the rainforest revealed a diverse ecosystem.
meanings.sent3: The biostrome of birds in the park chirped a cheerful melody.
meanings.sent4: In the bustling city, the biostrome of people moved like a synchronized dance.
meanings.sent5: The biostrome of insects in the garden hummed with life on a sunny day.
